text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention that the US court has authority to enforce an arbitral award that has been set aside under Article VII(1) of the New York Convention. The candidate answer discusses enforcement under the New York Convention generally, focusing on defenses under Article V and the pro-enforcement bias, but it never addresses the specific scenario or legal implication of an award being *set aside* at the seat and subsequently being subject to enforcement in the US under Article VII(1). Article VII(1) allows enforcement of awards that are no longer binding in the country of the award's making, which is distinct from the defenses raised under Article V.", "criterion_id": "741dc166-2b6b-4fcb-8301-a01449cd57b1"}
